definition: to respond accordingly to/to adapt to/to cope with
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: The appointee will be required to work irregular hours subject to operational needs.
sentences.chinese: 受聘人將須因應運作需要而不定時工作。

sentences.english: School fees will, from time to time, be adjusted due to inflation.
sentences.chinese: 學校每年之學費可能會因應通漲與特別需要稍作調整。

sentences.english: The floor-to-floor height in certain areas may differ due to different design requirements.
sentences.chinese: 部份樓面之樓層高度或會因應設計需要而有差異。

sentences.english: Among those changes, electronic commerce (e-commerce) is the product of science and technology trends.
sentences.chinese: 其中，電子商務便是因應此一科技趨勢的產物。

sentences.english: Teachers can employ different means of assessing their students as appropriate.
sentences.chinese: 教師可因應情況採納不同的方法來評覈學生的能力。

sentences.english: How can policymakers adjust to this change?
sentences.chinese: 政府當局能夠如何因應這樣的社會變遷呢？

sentences.english: Deshi (In house disciple) program grading is based on the discretion of the Chief Instructor.
sentences.chinese: 內弟子課程的考試是由總教練因應進度作出決定。

definition: to target/to focus on/to be aimed at or against/in response to
to add to existing facilities or services
to coordinate/to harmonize/to fit together/to match (colors etc)/harmonious/concerted
to correspond/answering (one another)/to agree (among the part)/corresponding/relevant/appropriate/(modify) accordingly
